text: Light green more like water color but light colored. Pear smell. Pear and some rice aroma. Sweet taste with nice warming aftertaste.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 0.7l bottle. Clear very pale yellow color with no head. Aroma of rice, herbs nad coconut. Taste is sour, sweet and little bitter.

Nearly clear shade. No head. Elements of pear, apple and vanilla in the aroma. Quite sweet and tasty mid-palate, ending a bit less interesting. Not possessing the complexity of more premium sakes, but has much more drinkability.
Tasting at WMBH, Zagreb. My first sake. Cloudy, no color, no head. Sugar, heavy syrup aroma. Very sweet. Some alcohol. Corn cookie wafer. Sweet finish.
Bottle from Tesco, Walsall. Clear sake, still. Aroma of vanilla, marzipan and coconut. Taste is sweetish, vanilla, some coconut water and a little alcohol warmth in the finish. Decent enough.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
I am Japanese. 
I expected more sweet taste and good aroma.
This is Karakuchi. 
Could you produce amakuchi too please ??

Bottle (gift) consumed at home. Colour is somewhere between water and Sauvignon Blanc. Smell of plum, peach and violet. Taste is very sweet with only a slight bitter-sour kick at the end. A real honey vanilla aftertaste. Im no sake connoisseur by any means but this was very nice at the end of a long day.

Bottle at a ChrisO tasting - London. Pours clear, no color. Lots of sugar, vanilla frosting, rice in the nose. Pretty big, sweet and boozy - not subtle. Some rice in there, along with straight alcohol. Full bodied with creamy. Warming finish, sugary sweet. Alright, but pretty basic.

Bottle 330ml.Clear crystal clear water colour with no head. Aroma is moderate rice, coconut, custard apple, alcohol. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, rice, alcohol, ruff - sharp. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholi. [20120501]
Bottled. Very pale golden colour, no head. Aroma is fruity, herbal, and rice. Flavour is rice, some floral and sweet notes. Mild spicy notes in the finish.

Bottle that I picked up at some random Asian supermarket consumed at Chrisos Easter tasting 2012. It pours clear. The nose is coconut, custard apple, creaminess and alcohol. The taste is smooth, coconut, custard, eggy and warming alcohol. Light-medium body and still. Not complex, but smooth and easy drinking. Ok.
Bottle at Chriso Easter Tasting 2012.  custard aroma. Its a bit disappointing. Not very complex. Dull
Bottle at chrisOs ... clear low viscous ... custardy ... light diohreah ... nose ... very sweet ...soft coconut and coconut husk ... not the best

A 0.5 l bottle from Kaufland, courtesy of Doggythedogy, thanks for sharing. It poured almost colorless body with weak thin legs. Alcoholic aroma, bit fruity in apple and raisins way, some wood and fine flowery note. Flavor is woody a bit as well, had that slight note of white wine, but without intensive flavor, all too watery body, which is on the other way normal for sakes Ive tried so far. Finish is short, not warming. I see some quality in this one although as I could recall I liked others maybe more.

0.5l bottle that weve found at the big Kaufland in Split. Tried it lukewarm. Poured a clear, still body, just ever so slightly touched by yellow, really really pale. The nose is atypical for a sake I guess, sweet raisins, nicely fruity. Of course, some underlying alcohol, noticable but not too bad. Typical "watery" mouthfeel for a sake, but soft and dry. Raisins again, fruity, slightly warming, some alcohol, but not much alcohol taste, which is a plus. I like it actually... dunno how genuine this is but its a nice try for something apparently not made in Japan.
